publications.title: Generation of two induced pluripotent stem cell lines from a patient with compound heterozygous mutations in the USH2A gene

donor.disease_description: Usher syndrome is an autosomal recessive disease characterized by hearing loss and progressive visual dysfunction in the form of retinitis pigmentosa (RP).

genomic_modifications.description: No gene modification; compound heterozygous mutations c.949C > A and c.1256G > T in USH2A gene

genomic_characterisation.summary: Normal diploid karyotype (46,XX) confirmed by Illumina HumanCoreExome-24 Beadchip SNP array. No chromosomal rearrangements detected.

induced_derivation.non_int_vector_name: Episomal iPSC Reprogramming Plasmid kit (SC900A-1, System Biosciences)

ethics.institutional_HREC: Sir Charles Gairdner Hospital Human Research Ethics Committee
